Lack of clean water, poor sanitation practices, poor access to health facilities across the country, social and political upheavals, and many refugees are the main factors responsible for the high number of sporadic cases of HAV and HEV in Pakistan. The Viral Hepatitis Surveillance System in Pakistan reported 3825 cases of acute hepatitis from June, 2010, to October, 2014, of which 679 were due to acute HAV and 468 to acute HEV.
139 Most children in Pakistan contract hepatitis A at an early age, leading to an almost 100% exposure by the age of 14 years, but HAV was reported in only 6% of adults. 42, 140 Despite a subclinical, asymptomatic course in most children, acute liver failure was reported in 30 of 232 children with HAV seen at Aga Khan University Hospital (Karachi), with 36Â·7% mortality from 1991 to 1998.
